page.title: 16Bonfire Night at Smarden
page.content: Each year Bonfire Night is celebrated by a torchlight procession of floats followed by a firework display. The event is organised by the youth club and teenagers carrying flaming torches lead the procession. Each float, decorated by a village group or club, is mounted on a lorry or trailer. Prizes are awarded to the best floats. They are led by a band along the route from the Old Rectory to Doctor's Corner and back to the Minnis. Crowds line The Street and afterwards gather round the bonfire, topped by a Guy, on Cornes Meadow. A firework display follows, paid for by local donations, and the money collected (Â£500 last year) goes to youth club funds. Drinks and hot dogs are sold as children dance round the bonfire, probably unaware that they are celebrating the death, long ago, of poor Guy Fawkes.
